# The `GCNMaxMemoryClauseSchedStrategy` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

The goal of this scheduling strategy is to maximize memory clause for a single wave. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

The goal of this scheduling strategy is to maximize memory clause for a single wave.

## Protected Member Functions

### tryCandidate() {#a9eba23f1b8a103c8e88a2ca6227d97b3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool GCNMaxMemoryClauseSchedStrategy::tryCandidate (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/genericschedulerbase/schedcandidate">SchedCandidate</a> &amp; Cand, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/genericschedulerbase/schedcandidate">SchedCandidate</a> &amp; TryCand, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/schedboundary">SchedBoundary</a> &#42; Zone) const</>}
  labels = {["protected", "virtual"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnmaxmemoryclauseschedstrategy">GCNMaxMemoryClauseSchedStrategy</a> tries best to clause memory instructions as much as possible.

This is achieved by: 
<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Cand">provides the policy and current best candidate.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="TryCand">refers to the next <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> candidate, otherwise uninitialized.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Zone">describes the scheduled zone that we are extending, or nullptr if Cand is from a different zone than TryCand.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
<code>true</code> if TryCand is better than Cand (Reason is NOT NoCand)
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnschedstrategy-h/#l00157">157</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnschedstrategy-h">GCNSchedStrategy.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnschedstrategy-cpp/#l00640">640</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnschedstrategy-cpp">GCNSchedStrategy.cpp</a>.
